abstract: Lions Gate is fending off a $7-a-share tender offer from Carl C. Icahn, while MGM is seeking to reorganize its $4 billion debt load.
snippet: Lions Gate is fending off a $7-a-share tender offer from Carl C. Icahn, while MGM is seeking to reorganize its $4 billion debt load.
lead_paragraph: Lions Gate Entertainment and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer have been holding merger talks, but it is not clear that a deal will emerge, people briefed on the matter said on Thursday.

headline.main: MGM Said to Be in Merger Talk
headline.print_headline: MGM Said to Be in Merger Talk

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
